clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of neutrophil-to Lymphocyte Ratio in Preeclampsia- Eclampsia
clinical_study.official_title: the Predictive Value of neutrophil-to Lymphocyte Ratio on Preeclampsia- Eclampsia

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Neutrophil/lymphocyte ratio (NLR) is a marker of systemic inflammation and endothelial dysfunction. In recent years, it has been reported that the individual components of the differential white cell count, specifically the neutrophil and lymphocyte counts,may have clinical utility in predicting diseases. An elevated NLR has been shown to be a prognostic indicator in various malignancies. İn the literature, many studies have been shown that NLR have predictive value in determining the prognosis of various diseases (cardiac or noncardiac diseases ). However, little is known about the predictive values of NLR in pregnancy complications. This study aimed to evaluate the potential predictive value of NLR in preeclampsia- eclampsia.

detailed_description.textblock:
In recent years, have been reported that the individual components of the differential white cell count, specifically the neutrophil and lymphocyte counts, may have clinical utility in predicting diseases.
An elevated NLR has been shown to be a prognostic indicator in various malignancies. İn the literatüre have been shown that NLR have predictive value in determining the prognosis of various diseases (cardiac or noncardiac diseases.However, little is known about the predictive values of NLR and PLR in gestational DM, preeclampsia and the other pregnancy complications.
Retrospective data were collected for patients who was diagnosed with , preeclampsia- eclampsia, The NLR was defined as the absolute neutrophil count divided by the absolute lymphocyte count.

primary_outcome.measure: the effect of neutrophil lymphocyte ratio in preeclampsia eclampsia
primary_outcome.description: during 6 months ,the patients who was recorded with preeclampsi/eclampsia at our hospital ,first trimester whole blood count was taken and neutrophil lymphocyte ratio was calculated and recorded

arm_group.description: do not expect poor pregnancy outcomes on normal patients
high ratio of Neutrophil / lymphocyte ratio may predict preeclampsia eclampsia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
pregnant women who developing preeclampsia eclampsia at pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
Known chronically maternal disease multiple pregnancy older than 40 years old
